details.title: Toss
details.content: India win toss and elect to bowl first
Aaron Finch wanted to bowl first

details.content:
We are off to The Gabba #TeamIndia #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/RF9ReN2mx3

details.title: From the toss
details.content:
India have won the toss and elected to bowl first #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/DgwRrjsb6X

details.title: Aussie quick prepares before the start of play
details.content:
Big bad bustling Bill! #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/eGgV4W6276

details.title: The battle is on
details.content:
India 🇮🇳 win the toss and elect to field in the first T20I against Australia 🇦🇺 in Brisbane.

Follow #AUSvIND live 👇https://t.co/TpS5WMHWvf pic.twitter.com/dNdZcs7qV0

— ICC (@ICC) November 21, 2018

details.title: Show time!
details.content: via

details.title: Bhuvi starts proceedings
details.content: Bhuvneshwar Kumar opens the bowling for India. D'arcy Short and Aaron Finch open batting for the hosts.

details.title: Bumrah from the other end
details.content: Jasprit Bumrah comes into the attack in the second over.
5/0 at the end of two overs

details.title: First boundary!
details.content:
Australia ends over on a high note
Score: 13/0 after 3 overs.

details.title: Dropped!
details.content: Virat Kohli drops a sitter as Aaron Finch gets lifeline early on

details.title: When you see Virat dropping a catch!
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Back to back boundaries
details.content:
Australia back on track with two boundaries in the fourth over. 

Australia: 24/0

Overs: 4

details.title: First wicket falls!
details.content: Bowling change works as Khaleel Ahmed strikes. D'Arcy Short toe-ends a fuller delivery and the ball ends up in Kuldeep Yadav's hands.

details.title: Chris Lynn walks in
details.content: Lynn hits a boundary on his very first delivery

details.title: Score
details.content:
Australia: 31/1
Overs: 5

details.title: Harsha speaks
details.content:
I wonder what the pecking order for keeping wickets is. And whether Pant keeping today is a decisive move because it means Karthik has to earn his place as a pure batsman.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) November 21, 2018

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia: 38/1 Overs: 6

details.title: Kuldeep Yadav comes in
details.content: Virat Kohli introduces spin attack after the end of powerplay.

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia: 42/1 Overs: 7

details.title: Maximum!
details.content: Chris Lynn launches a full delivery from Khaleel for six over mid-wicket.

details.title: Three sixes in the over!
details.content:
21 runs of 8th over. Chris Lynn hits three sixes to get Australia back on track.

Australia: 63/1 Overs: 8

details.title: Watching the ball when Lynn is at the crease be like
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Captain's gesture
details.content:
Captain Kohli with a heart-warming gesture before the start of game at The Gabba #TeamIndia #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/KPANHQ78FT

— BCCI (@BCCI) November 21, 2018

details.title: Oz skipper departs
details.content: Kuldeep Yadav dismisses Aaron Finch as the ball takes the outside edge and flies to Khaleel Ahmed at backward point.

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia: 67/2 Overs: 9

details.title: Lynn on fire
details.content: The Kolkata Knight Riders batsman hits Krunal Pandya for his fourth six of the match.

details.title: One of Lynn's maximum
details.content:
BANG! Lynn goes large and Old Mate takes the grab in the stands!

Watch live via Kayo: https://t.co/HW09hVOINP #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/GyOedGw9pB

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 21, 2018

details.title: Chinaman to the rescue!
details.content:
Kuldeep Yadav dismisses the dangerous-looking Lynn with a return catch

 

(File photo | AP)

details.title: DRS...
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Decision revised
details.content: Marcus Stoinis successfully overturns an LBW decision by the umpire to stay alive. Disappointment for Krunal Pandya.

details.title: Four more!
details.content: Stoinis pulls Khaleel to move to double-digits. He is now on 13 off 8 deliveries.

details.title: Expensive Khaleel
details.content: The Rajasthan seamer has given away 42 runs from 3 overs

details.title: Maxwell on fire!
details.content: The right-hander punishes Krunal Pandya for three back-to-back sixes as he races into 30s.

details.title: Fifty partnership!
details.content: The two all-rounders now share 52 runs between them.

details.title: Ohh Krunal...
details.content: The Mumbaikar finsihes at 55-0 at the end of his spell.

details.title: Dropped... again
details.content: Khaleel drops Stionis at third-man as India misses a golden opportunity to break the partnership.

details.title: Pause - it's 'raining'
details.content:
No, not raining sixes; it's really drizzling in Brisbane

via GIPHY

details.title: Most runs conceded by an Indian bowler in a T20I:
details.content: Yuzvendra Chahal-64 (v South Africa) Centurion, 2018 Joginder Sharma-57 (v England) Durban, 2007 Krunal Pandya- 55 (v Australia) Gabba, 2018- Today

details.title: The ball hits the spider-cam!
details.content:
"It's hit the Fox!"

Just wait for the camera shot at the end! #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/yoouEWxc9u

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 21, 2018

details.title: ICC tweets
details.content:
Rain has stopped play in Brisbane! 🌧️

Australia are 153/3 after 16.1 overs with Glenn Maxwell on 46 and Marcus Stoinis on 31.#AUSvIND 1st T20I live 👇https://t.co/TpS5WMHWvf pic.twitter.com/dKN2kTltbw

— ICC (@ICC) November 21, 2018

details.title: Most wickets after 15 T20Is:
details.content:
Kuldeep Yadav- 31

Ajantha Mendis- 29

Yuzvendra Chahal- 27

Umar Gul/ Ahsan Malik/ Ish Sodhi- 26

Imran Tahir/ Kesrick Williams- 25

details.title: Rain has stopped
details.content: Umpires are out inspecting if the play can be resumed.

details.title: The Gabba will have a wet outfield
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Rain effect: Match reduced to 17 overs per side
details.content: The game is all set to resume after being delayed for almost an hour due to the shower. The Baggy Greens have five more deliveries left to play.

details.title: 5 balls left
details.content:
It an all clear. It will be a 17 over game. #TeamIndia will bowl 5 more deliveries. Play to restart 8:05PM local time #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/z511TiKEF6

— BCCI (@BCCI) November 21, 2018

details.title: Maxwell gone!
details.content: Bumrah strikes on the first ball after the rain break.

details.title: First innings score:
details.content:
Australia: 158/4

Overs: 17

details.title: The openers walk out
details.content: Indian openers Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan are out in the middle. Behrendorff to start proceedings for Australia.

details.title: Target
details.content: India are chasing 174 runs in 17 overs

details.title: First Boundary!
details.content: Shikhan Dhawan opens India's account of boundaries.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 11/0

Overs: 1

details.title: Hitman stats!
details.content: Rohit Sharma to overtake Martin guptill as the highest run-getter in T20Is if he score 65 runs or more in this innings.

details.title: Maxwell's innings!
details.content:
WHACK!  Loads of entertainment in Glenn Maxwell's knock at the Gabba!#AUSvIND @Toyota_Aus pic.twitter.com/Co8H13sw4Z

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 21, 2018

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 18/0
Overs: 2

details.title: Escape
details.content: Dhawan miscues a shot but it falls in no man's land.

details.title: Hitman gone!
details.content: Rohit Sharma tries to play Jason Behrendorff for a maximum, only to end up in Aaron Finch's hands.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 41/1
Overs: 5

details.title: Back to back boundaries
details.content: Shikhar Dhawan hits consecutive boundaries off Andrew Tye.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 53/1

Overs: 6

details.title: Welcome with a boundary
details.content: KL Rahul welcomes Adam Zampa with a boundary.

details.title: Stumped?
details.content: KL Rahul survives a stumping call off Zampa.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 61/1
Overs: 7

details.title: Dhawan celebrates early
details.content: Shikhar Dhawan raises his bat after reaching to 49 with a six.

details.title: Fifty for Dhawan
details.content: Dhawan gets to a quickfire fifty off 28 deliveries.

details.title: 17 off the over
details.content:
India: 78/1
Overs: 8

details.title: LED wickets lighten up
details.content: Bails fall off the keeper's gloves.

details.title: LED wickets lighten up
details.content: Bails fall off the keeper's gloves.

details.title: Wicket?
details.content: KL Rahul awaits third umpire's decision for a close stumping call.

details.title: OUT!
details.content: The big screen says 'OUT' as third umpire gives KL Rahul stumped out. That was a close call.

details.title: Virat Kohli in!
details.content: Indian skipper Virat Kohli comes in to bat.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 84/2
Overs: 9

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 93/2
Overs: 10

details.title: Dropped!
details.content: Adam Zampa drops a caught and bowled chance to dismiss Shikhar Dhawan.

details.title: Kohli falls!
details.content: Wicket number three for Australia as Indian skipper miscues an Adam Zampa delivery to short thirdman.

details.title: How close was that?
details.content:
It doesn't get much closer than that! #CloseMatters#AUSvIND @GilletteAU pic.twitter.com/9R6smFMpTA

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 21, 2018

details.title: Dropped!
details.content: Shikhar Dhawan dropped by Nathan Coulter-Nile at deep fine leg.

details.title: Dhawan is out!
details.content: Indian opener Shikhar Dhawan tries to clear the thirdman boundary but ends up holing it to Behrendorff off Stanlake.

details.title: WATCH | TNIE's analysis of the match
Score
details.content:
India: 114/4

Overs: 13

details.title: Six!
details.content: Pant hits a maximum over fine leg off Andrew Tye.

details.title: That's a six!
details.content: Dinesh Karthik smashes Andrew Tye over mid-wicket. Maxwell takes a catch but has grounded his legs outside the boundary before he can throw the ball in.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India: 139/4

Overs: 14

details.title: Target
details.content: 35 off 18 balls

details.title: That was interesting, Maxwell
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Four more!
details.content: DK keeps the Indian hopes alive

details.title: Target
details.content: 27 off 14 balls

details.title: Freehit wasted
details.content: Pant manages to fetch just one run out of it.

details.title: Target
details.content: 24 runs off 12 balls

details.title: 50 partnership
details.content: Karthik and Pant bring up a 50 run partnership. Indian inching closer to victory. 18 required off 10 deliveries.

details.title: Pant departs!
details.content: Rishab Pant tries to scoop Andrew Tye over the in-field on the off side. Doesn't connect well. Ends up holing it to Behrendorff at cover point.

details.title: Target
details.content: 13 runs off 6 balls

details.title: This is gonna be close...
details.content: via GIPHY

details.title: Karthik on strike!
Pandya falls!
details.content: Krunal Pandya is out in the last over. 11 runs required off 3 deliveries. Can Karthik finish it?

details.title: Another wicket!
details.content: Stoinis is on a hattrick as he gets Dinesh Karthik. 11 runs to get from 2 balls.

details.title: Wide!
details.content: 10 from 2 balls

details.title: Australia win!
details.content: Australia win the first T20I by 4 runs.

details.title: Harsha Tweets!
details.content:
Guess Karthik will wonder if he should have run the second from the 1'st ball of the over. But top innings in the situation

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) November 21, 2018

Australia win by four runs by the DLS method!

An excellent last over from Marcus Stoinis gets Australia over the line. He dismissed the dangermen Krunal Pandya and Dinesh Karthik. #AUSvIND FOLLOW 👇https://t.co/TpS5WMZxTP pic.twitter.com/vjP3MJfaKY

— ICC (@ICC) November 21, 2018
